Sub: PRECAUTIONS IN SECURITY CHECKS OF NON-EXEMPTED
DIPLOMATS : Req

BCAS vide its Circulars on VVIPs exempted from pre-embarkation
security check (Circular No. 06/2009 presently in vogue) prescribes for
exemption for the Ambassadors/ High Commissioners/ Charge D' Affairs
and their spouses. Diplomats of categories lower than these are obviously
not exempted from pre-embarkation security checks (PESC).

02. Of late it has been reported that some of the Diplomats (non-
exempted) have objected to the procedure being adopted during their pre-
embarkation checks. Further enquiries have revealed that their objection is
regarding their person being touched by the HHMD or by hand of the frisker
during this process. The matter has been examined. As the ASG staff is
aware, the procedure for pre-embarkation check is described as ‘touch free’.
Therefore, the ASGs should make all efforts to ensure that the prescribed
procedure is followed while performing the pre-embarkation checks so that
no objection arise on this score.

03. All CASOs will ensure strict compliance of the above instructions.
